title: We’re Hiring: Content Writer (SEO Specialist)
job_overview:
Location: Remote (PH-based preferred)
Start Date: ASAP
Experience: 2+ Years in SEO Content Writing

About the Role
You don’t just write words —
 You create content that ranks, converts, and sounds like it was written by a real human (because it was).
If you’re fluent in search intent, know your way around SERPs, and can explain meta descriptions without Googling it… we’d love to see your work.

We’re looking for an SEO-savvy Content Writer who understands how to make both readers and Google happy — without sounding like a keyword-stuffed zombie.

 What You’ll Do:
• Write engaging, SEO-optimized content for blogs, landing pages, and core website pages
• Conduct keyword research and apply best practices for on-page SEO
• Work closely with design and marketing teams to align content with brand goals
• Refresh and optimize older articles based on performance and analytics
• Stay updated on Google algorithm updates and content marketing trends

You Might Be a Fit If You:
• Have 2+ years of experience writing SEO content
• Write like a human — not like a plugin
• Understand search intent, formatting, internal linking, and metadata
• Have used tools like SurferSEO, Ahrefs, SEMrush, or Clearscope
• Bonus: You’ve written for SaaS, UX, or design-focused brands (and know what UX means)

Perks & Benefits:
• 100% Remote Work: Write from your favorite spot (as long as there’s Wi-Fi)
• Creative Freedom: Your ideas matter — no rigid templates here
• Monthly PTO: Recharge with regular paid time off
• Recognition: Contribute to content that gets real visibility (and high-fives)
• Maternity/Paternity Leave: For qualified teaUpgrade to see actual infombers (1+ year & performance-based)
• Earn Points: Get rewarded for joining team events and activities
• Friendly Team: No drama, no hierarchy — just smart creatives doing great work
• Career Growth: Grow your skills, pitch ideas, and level up

How to Apply:
We don’t do generic. If you’ve read this far — prove it. ????

Upgrade to see actual info

2. On the first question — “Please type the magic phrase” — enter:
 iwriteforhumans (or use the phrase given in your job post)

3. Attach your portfolio or relevant work samples when prompted.

Let’s build content that earns clicks and hearts.
 (And if you’ve ever gotten a featured snippet… we’re already fans.)
